content.description: SDS from the rock matched on a side pull. Fun climbing on nice ledges leads to a thoughtful top out.
content.location: Slab on the far left of the Washroom outcrop

content.description: SDS with left hand on a side pull in the dihedral and right far out on an edge. A perplexing move gains you the crack which leads to the top out.
SDS with left hand on a sharp crimp and right in a tips slot. An improbable mantel and a few tenuous slab moves lead to the top out. A very satisfying climb.
content.location: Center of the slab feature in the Washroom cut.

content.description: SDS with right hand in a slot and left wherever is comfortable. Work through the vertical featured face one the left side of the overhang using a sharp crimp before gunning for the lip.
Start as for Loofah Roofah Right, but head straight up through the bulging arête and top out.
content.location: Right side of the Loofah Roof

content.description: Start crouched with left hand in a slot and right on a side-pull around the arête. A few awkward moves lead to a mellow top out.
content.location: Furthest right line on the Washroom outcrop.

content.description: SDS with left hand in the slot and right on a nearby sloper. Head right towards a micro crimper before powering through the overhanging bulge. Brutal.
content.location: 40 degree overhanging prow on the far left side of the Washroom cut.

content.description: SDS with right hand on a low side-pull and left on an edge. Traverse left to the big flake before working into the cool roof feature. Skirt left to top out. Fun moves on cool holds.
content.location: Just right side of the roof section of the Washroom

content.description:
SDS with a low pinch on the flake for the right and a sloping crimp for the left. Climb up and into the neat roof feature. Trend left and top out. 

 A super hard variation may be possible starting matched on the slopey crimps directly under the roof.
content.location: The prominent roof right of Power Shower

content.description: SDS matched on a crimp seam. Awkward climbing in the dihedral leads to a sweet crack and mellow top out.
content.location: Left side of the dihedral on the far right of the Washroom outcrop.

content.description: SDS matched on the seam low on the arête. A techy mantle leads to a few small holds beneath a mellow top out.
content.location: Right side of the slab feature in the center of the Washroom Cut

content.description: SDS with right hand in a left facing slot and left hand on a small crimp. Climb the left face of the dihedral. Topping out straight up (without traversing left into the crack) sustains the route's difficulty and provides for a more full-value climb.
content.location: Dihedral on the far right side of the Washroom cut.

content.description: SDS with a left hand crimp at the lip of the bulge and right hand on the blocky fin feature. Surmount the bulge and head through nice edges on the slab before topping out.
content.location: Left side of the A-shaped prow in the center of the Washroom cut.

content.description: SDS with both hands on the blocky rail feature. Make a powerful move to the right arête and compress it to the top. Harder for short folks.
A 50 foot-long cut of overhanging gneiss high on the South Ridge. Climbs range from 10 to 12 feet in height and have excellent landings. Many link-ups and traverses are possible.
